title.content-text: 1.2.3 - Switch Features in a Hierarchical Network

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts Access Layer switch features.

Network Topology:
Consists of three Access Layer switches, S1, S2, and S3. Each switch is connected to two Distribution Layer switches: D1 and D2. D1 and D2 are connected to two Core Layer switches: C1 and C2. A laptop computer and an IP phone are connected to each Access Layer switch.

Access Layer switch features include port security, V LAN's, Fast Ethernet or Gigabit Ethernet, P o E, link aggregation, and Quality of Service (Q o S).
